title: Making Equivalent Polar to Cartesian Substitutions
text: $$r=\sqrt{x^2+y^2}$$, $$x=r cos\left(\theta\right)$$, $$y=r sin\left(\theta\right)$$. Making these substitutions, we get $$2\sqrt{x^2+y^2}+2y=4$$
speech: r is equal to the square root of x squared plus y squared end root ,  x is equal to, rcos of theta, ,  y is equal to rsin of theta, . Making these substitutions, we get  2, the square root of x squared plus y squared end root plus 2 y is equal to 4
